page.title: 04Archaeologists at the Castle
page.content: On Tuesday we went to Marisco Castle. David Thackery,Archaeologist to the National Trust,showed us round. Although known as Marisco Castle the pirate Marisco's have nothing to do with it.It was built after them- and rebuilt in 1643 by mintmaster and Royalist Thomas Bushell.It is this occupation that they plan to reveal and preserve. Digging started in August 1984 when only the tops of the walls could be seen.While we were there members of a N.T.Acorn workcamp were helping with the dig.So far they have found a big room with a fireplace,a clay bread oven,a furnace, a brick building with a cobbled floor and the drilling yard.They have also found pottery, pocket knives, buttons, thimbles, cannonballs and coins-one showing King Luke of Ireland. {David Hinchliffe.
